intro: Oreopanax apurimacensis, commonly known as the Apurimac oreopanax, is a species of flowering plant in the Araceae family. It is native to the high-altitude regions of southern Peru, particularly in the Apurímac Valley. The plant is characterized by its large, palm-like leaves that are often deeply veined and have a glossy surface. It produces striking inflorescences with brightly colored spathes and small, clustered flowers. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
